text: taco, rice, and beans heaven. Their dinner entrees are gigantuous and most under $10, satisfying both quality and quantity in mexican food. They grill all the meats in front of you, and each entree comes with two huge tubes of medium and mild(tomato based) salsa. The refried beans are top notch, and definitely rival anything I've had in Champaign (which btw Champaign has wonderful Mexican food). The tacos themselves are not your saucer sized tacos you'll get anywhere downtown, they are 2-corn tortillas stacked with a mountain of meat and tomatoes, sour cream, lettuce, and a flood of sauce options. Not to mention they give you TWO of those WITH a huge side of rice and beans, and you can choose from a list of meats...all for about $8.  Also tried the huevos rancheros (which also comes with rice and beans...almost everything here comes with large scoops of those two), which came with a large stack of hot corn tortillas; and the chimichanga (sooo good). So much food for such good value open at such a late time. Food coma man. Only thing is that chips don't come with your entree (but you wont have room for it anyways) and the horchata was a little watery (wouldn't recommend that option).
Chill Lakeview late night.  Great employees.  Good vegetarian selection and fast service.  A classic Lakeview fav.

Got a burrito in the evening and found it to be ok, nothing special, but it was very reasonably priced for a huge burrito which was certainly appreciated. Just tasted like a generic burrito with some generic Mexican flavors. It's definitely targeting the late night crowd but if I'm looking for better Mexican, I'm going to Tarascas on Clark or Tortahaus on Diversey.  Weirdly, their credit card machine doesn't accept credit cards with chips.
I used to live by this place before I moved back for texas. Closest thing I got to good Mexican food while living in Chicago and being from texas, I have high standards for Mexican food!
Great place for quick and tasty Mexican food. Very flavorful and a great deal! I got the large burrito and shared it with a friend. It was enough for a small meal
1994 I was here. Same restaurant. Same people. Different location. Moved over a few space. Hopefully food is still good.

So I must admit the only time I visit this location is after I have had my fair share of liquid libation. I always settle for the steak or beef tacos. The tacos are palatable and stacked to perfection. Your order is prepared fast and there is enough room to seat in or for the local party goers to pour in for their after hour snack. Most importantly it is "Clean" bathroom included.

I wanted to try a chimichanga so after going thru Yelp, I decided to give this place a try.   Ordered a chimichanga, steak burrito, and chicken enchilada, it came with beans and rice.  The steak was a tad bit dry and chopped up a bit too small(for me) however, it was tasty. Horchata(rice water) was refreshing and spiced well.  Cheap eats and nice customer service. Went back the next day. :0)

Been coming for years and something I really appreciate in a restaurant is consistency! So, let's just say I have been coming here for years! I was a teenager (15), when I was introduced to this place. I now have a one year old son who loves this place too, I am now in my mid 30's and will take a taco or two when I croak! Love them to death. Great staff with good memory of patrons, clean and fast and great f***ing food!!!!

Such a life saver on the weekends, great men who work there they can make your tacos American or traditional, also vegetarian friendly, great horchata, & just a nice place to go with friends especially late at night after a party

This place is as good as it gets as far as Chicago Mexican food goes.  I will intentionally party near here to stop there afterwards and have a phenomenal burrito.  Everything there is amazing though.  My best friend and I stumbled upon this place a year ago and we always end up here at the end of the night, even if it means gallivanting around in circles for 30 min in the cold trying to find it (true story - Halloween 2016, totally worth it).  It's always busy too which should tell you something but service is still FAST.
If I'm being 100% honest, I've never experienced this place sober. That said, I've always enjoyed my experience and get a good amount of food for a fairly cheap price. Highly recommend as drunk food.
Another great neighborhood find!!! Great burritos, both vegetarian and meat-filled---Super-casual---Just right when you have a taste for spicy food.

Does not get better than the deuce for Mexican food done right, quickly, and inexpensively anytime of the day or night.  At 2am I would rate this 5 stars (other than the line out the door in the winter).

Oh lordy! Came to this place with my cousin and a huge appetite after the Black Sabbath concert a few weeks ago. We were both in the mood for their tacos (although I have heard good things about their quesadillas too!) I ordered 2 pollo tacos and 1 carne asada, and boy oh boy, were they amazing!  For starters, they were much bigger than I expected! Bear in mind that tacos here cost only 2 bucks and some change. Considering, we were there around midnight, the food was fresh and filling. Do drizzle some of their special hot sauce on your tacos for that kick.  Both the pollo and carne asada tacos were equally flavorful so it's hard to judge between them. I recommend ordering both! They could have gone a little easy on the lettuce in these tacos but I am not going to complain about it because half the lettuce always falls out as it is! Couple the delicious, inexpensive meal with very polite counter service and a clean eatery, and you have an amazing spot in the DePaul area to come and satisfy your late night cravings. Will definitely be back!

Maybe the food would have been good. Advertise that is open until 3 AM, got there at five minutes before 2 AM and they were closed. Would not even speak to us. Turned around and went one block  to Allende Tacos @ 2408 N Lincoln, Best tacos I ever had. Compares to King Taco in LA. They also were trying to close, advertised as open until 3 AM. They made us eat outside.

Best place for a quick authentic mexican meal! I typically go with the taco dinner which comes with two tacos and rice a beans. The tacos are loaded with fresh ingredients. The staff is very friendly and always smiling. Highly reccommend!

Great late night food spot! Customers and staff are usually funny and friendly, when crowded! Some of the best carne asada nachos around town and a good price as well! Also to my surprise, a good tastin Mexican burger that is full of flavor for being a frozen 1/4 patty. Burritos are great too! I love the fact that they put rice inside of them...yeah! Late-late nighters love to get the breakfast burrito...says that it cures hangovers...lol! A must try...
The best taco joint in the city. The staff is super friendly and the tacos are ridiculously tasty (and ridiculously cheap). No way to beat it.
The palace of broken dreams and no tacos. Not open until 5am. They will lock the door and eat tacos in front of your face, knowing you are hungry and desperate.

Came here last night for some tacos. I find the area to be lacking decent Mexican food at a cheap place so I'm glad I found this place. I got carne asada tacos. They were a lot bigger than I expected and. Wish I only ordered two. I also wish I just got cilantro and onion on it instead of everything (lettuce, cheese, tomato, sour cream). The meat itself was a little salty for my taste, but the tortillas were excellent. The prices aren't bad at a little over $2 a taco, and they have daily specials.

Tacos were pretty loaded with fresh meat, cheese, lettuce, sour cream, and they had some salsas on the side(red and green), which were standard but still tasty. Got the burrito suiza, which was basically everything that was in the tacos stuffed in a burrito, and it was a pretty giant portion which only set me back $8(I got fancy and sprung for some fresh avocado in there). If I lived closeby, this would definitely be my go-to place at least once a week for some good, cheap Mexican food.  Verdict: Food is plentiful, Food is good, Food is cheap. Also the name of the place is fun to say. I'm a fan.
Not too bad. They didn't close the ends of my burrito though, so even tho I didn't order a drink, I had a nice cup of burrito juice to go with my meal.
Friendly staff and the food is always always amazing. One day I ate here 2 twice.. I can't say enough about this place.

Great service. Cheap. Simple. Yummy. Those would be the words I use to describe this place! I've actually gone a few times, and really enjoy it. They cook everything to order, and I'm pretty sure the tortillas are homemade?? My friend and I had it once when he was in town to visit, and he always asks for us to go back there when he is in town!

Living in Los Angeles has definitely spoiled me when it comes to tacos. Decided to stop in here after a night out at Kingston mines. Carne asada tacos were average. I guess this is the place if you want Mexican food at 2am in Chicago, but it did not satisfy our cravings at all.

Taco and Burrito Palace #2 is the perfect spot for late night grub! I came after a night of bar hopping, and even at 2 am, the place had a decent number of people eating and hanging out. There is open seating, and you place your order and pay for your food at the counter. The staff here are polite, incredibly nice, and very accommodating. They are definitely a hardworking bunch, as the place stays open until 5 am! I ordered a steak quesadilla dinner which came to be a little over $7. My quesadilla was filled with cheese, steak, and LOTS of guac. Can't complain there. The rice and refried beans are pretty standard, and their salsas provide just the right amount of heat.  Taco and Burrito Palace #2, you provide cheap, fast, and really tasty Mexican food. Definitely looking forward to coming back the next time I'm in the area!

Great food for either late night or a stop after work to pick up a quick dinner. I have been going here for years, even when they were located a few doors down. It's nothing fancy, just good fresh made-to-order food. Their burritos are excellent and love their guacamole and chips - always fresh and delicious. Service is great, always fast and polite ... one of favorites for a quick bite and so reasonably priced!!
This place is decent but nothing amazing. Had the small chicken burrito and for $5 you really can't complain. Wouldn't mind going back to try one of their combo meals when I'm a little more hungry.
Good, cheap tacos!  Was in the area and had a taste for tacos so, after checking Yelp reviews, I stopped by. The beef taco dinner did not disappoint. Back now 2 days later. Yum!
Went to this place to check out their tacos... not that great.. maybe after drinking yes..
In the area? Stop here for a burrito supreme or tacos (pork & steak). Low key atmosphere but the food is solid.

My best friend and I drunkenly stumbled into this place on Halloween, because it was busy. I was hoping for the best, because I did not yelp it beforehand... And it was great! The food was cheap and delicious! I definitely want to make it back here again.

Great food and service.  As others have said, very clean.  They have good daily deals / specials including drink: Mon Taco Dinner Tues Chimichanga Wed Enchilladas Thurs Burrito Suizos Fri Nachos supreme

My best friend took me in here after a night of drinking, despite me pushing for IHOP, but I begrudgingly walked in. This place has now become one of my favorites in Chicago. The cooks know what they're doing, and they're always super friendly even at 2 in the morning dealing with the drunks. Tip those guys, they deserve it. Keep in mind they do have a rule where you can't pay with a card unless you charge over 8$ or 9$, one of them, but there's an ATM inside and they're all over Halsted anyway. I get the plain steak tacos, and those things are an orgasm in my mouth.
Shockingly cheap. Wait staff is very friendly and let us bring in a case of beer and hang out/eat for a while. Food is good, nothing spectacular but you get what you pay for. Will be back many times

Absolutely love this place. I've been coming here since I was 9 years old (that's a long time). Followed the guys that work there from location #1 on Clark St. to Halsted, then a little further north on Halsted. There's no place like it.  On another note, I noticed that the new owner is now working behind the counter. He needs to realize that most of the customers are regulars.. you might want to be nice to everyone and I truly mean.. EVERYONE! Also, stop using cheaper filler in items like burritos and chimichangas. I don't drive over an hour for a tomato filled burrito. I really hope he reads these and adheres. If not, it will break my heart to have to pass by on the rare occasions I'm north and it will definitely stop me from hauling over an hour for midnight tacos.
The only place I've found in Chicago that can replicate the tacos in Southern California. So good. And the guys who work here are amazing!
one of my fav fast food taco joints. the BEST beef tongue taco. nice and clean space.

I love, love this place!! I used to work by their #1 location and I was sad when I moved but I found out their #2 location is within 10 min from my office so I visit them pretty often :) Their steak taco's are awesome!

I love this place so much that my girlfriend actually resents it now, due to me having her drive me across town to get these delectable tacos on the daily. I can't get enough of this place. Nothing fancy, but they've got what I like to eat and the right staff cooking it up with a smile. Now all I need is some flan on the menu so I can convince my girl to take me here even more than usual.
This place is the bomb. Nuf said. Everything is great and the cooks are nice and good spirited.

Grungy hole in the wall....but the best steak burrito on this planet.......made fresh in front of your  drunken eyes on the griddle....superlative red and green salsa...eat it in the window and watch the never ending Halsted St. parade  march by....grab a beer from 7-11.....good stuff.!
Had the Guac and chips for starters really good, also had a Steak Torta food was great. Good place for an after hours hangout. Staff was really nice and very interactive.

As an avid lover of Mexican food (especially as late night food), Taco Burrito Palace #2 is hands down the some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. The food is very authentic and always fresh - even when I stumble in at 3 AM! I would give five stars to the staff as well, they're always so welcoming and kind every time we've been in. Even with the multitude of late night Mexican restaurants in this small area, this one tops the list.
I love the breakfast burritos here. I haven't tried anything else because they're so delicious and I get one every time I go in.

I stopped in for lunch on a Tuesday to a 1/3 full restaurant and ordered chicken nachos as a meal. The amount of chicken was a meal in itself, and was obviously cooked and pulled on site. Every chip was loaded with cheese, chicken, guacamole, sour cream and the occasional jalapeno. The dish was hot, fresh and no soggy chips. For a taco stand, the interior is nicely tiled and decorated, as well as way clean.

Been coming here for their steak burritos for 7 years that I've lived in Lincoln park literally a block down from this place. Their guac and chips are really good too which they make fresh and add my cilantro for me. Adrian always takes care of me, love the staff so welcoming everytime!

The name Taco and Burrito Palace #2 doesn't boast anything fancy, but these guys seriously know what they're doing. Their salsa. I actually cannot even describe it. It is absurdly good. I can't really even put into words why I am obsessed with it. It's rather spicy but addictively delicious. Every meal at TBP2 is an internal battle between wanting to ingest more and more exquisite salsa on everything and fearing for the loss of my taste buds to euphoric spiciness. Their quesadillas and tacos are fantastic and fresh.   I've started calling the place "TBP2" for short because it's really such a common part of my weekly routine. In about a year and a half of living nearby, I have probably dined-in and ordered take-out from Taco and Burrito Palace #2 well over 20 times. (You know what, if I'm being honest, it's probably over 50. I'm really not exaggerating). I love TBP2. It's just so good.
Consistent over a few years of visits, clean, friendly, and good quality. My go to neighborhood taco joint.

I went here after a good night at Kingston Mines. I ordered large fries, two tacos and an horchata. Everything was great. The flavor on the meats and the sauces were on point. The flour tortillas were were grilled too so they had a nice crisp around the rim. The horchata was perfect too. It wasn't too sweet and wasn't watered down.

Every Time I am in the area I have to have it!! the consistency over the years is amazing.  The burrito is long and thin and grilled perfectly crispy, with the right balance of ingredients.  It's very well excited steak burrito.  Glorious burrito

I don't like giving out 5 stars but this place is the best. The guys who work there couldn't be nicer and the food is delicious. Late night, lunch or breakfast -- I've had it all there and every menu item is fantastic.

This place is excellent for late night food as well as any other time of day.  The guys are always friendly and helpful.  I've lived nearby for over two years and I would say I've been maybe once a week.  I don't feel any shame over that either!  The place is clean, the prices fair, and the food is excellent!
Awesome food and awesome guys working there. An A+ establishment. I love the tacos and enchiladas. Very fair prices.

Visiting Chicago, and stopped in due to high Yelp rating. Ordered a Super Burrito ... and it was huge!  About as long as a 10" plate's diameter.  Plenty for two meals.  Not the very best, but still pretty good. Service was quick, and staff was friendly.  I think there were only four or five tables, so it appears to be primarily a take out place. I'll be back, for sure.

This is the first place I hit up when I'm back in my hometown!  THE BEST carne asada tacos.  The meat is sooooo juicy and flavorful!!   The horchata is delicious.  Everything is perfectly cooked.  Also try the tortilla soup!  The restaurant and bathroom are super clean.  The staff are super friendly.  I LOVE this place!!  So great that they're always open when I'm having a craving.  :-)

This place is fantastic. Never disappoints. When I moved to Chicago from the Detroit area, I had serious issues being away from the best Mexican restaurant ever created- Mexico Lindo. It took me two years to find the next best thing in my heart, Taco Burrito Palace #2. I've yet to have better Mexican food in Chicago

This makes most taco places look like taco bell :D I went to this place yesterday. I thought it was closing but the employee was very nice and welcoming. We were in 7 people and we order different stuff. All plates were super delicious.

I'm going to give this place 5 stars.  Came here late night after a night out and got some tacos al pastor...it was the bomb!  It might have been because I was shit faced but that shit was amazing!  I live literally right next door and only been there once but I will def be goin again the next time I'm craving Mexican!

First of all, they upcharged on everything. Ordered the chilaquiles with egg, small fajita burrito, and Huevos rancheros. Was charged for chilaquiles with meat and a large burrito but when our order came up it was what we had ordered. I'd be sure to ask for an itemized receipt.  If you're going to use a  restaurant.com  certificate make sure it is printed off on paper or they will not honor it (figured that out the first time we tried to go).  The food itself was great. The chilaquiles were tasty, as were the Huevos ranchero. The eggs were over cooked though. It's unfortunate that the service was dishonest otherwise this would be a great spot for some late night Mexican.

This place is fantastic for late night burritos! I've been going to this place since 2004, and rave about their burrito suizo w chorizo! Their new location isn't far from where the first restaurant was, and is much nicer than their old one. I swear, after having not been to the place in 3 years, one of the cooks remembered my face and asked if I would have my usual with a friendly smile. I guess that just proves my addiction to TBK2!

Gosh. I haven't been to many Mexican restaurants as I would like, but this place is hands down the best that I ever had! My friend brought me here for the first time two months ago, I fell in love right away I never liked bean and rice much in Mexican restaurant because it is always lack of flavor, but this place is totally different. I get the Taco dinner every freaking time, and it always tastes the same! Taste great and consistent. The steak is not dry and taste newly-made. Lettuce and tomato were always fresh ( there is just a way that you can taste rather the vegetable is fresh or not "for me at least"). This place is real good. No tips necessary even though it is a dine-in. Staffs are very friendly.  This place hands down 10x times better than Allende. I swear that I get stomachache every time I eat there. I only order fries from Allende. I already recommended all my friends to go to Taco & Burrito Palace #2. Seriously, why no.2?! I bet if this place switch spot with Allende, Allende would NOT even survive.

I live way too close to this place. I have tried many tacos throughout Chicago, and I keep coming back for these. I could eat their pork tacos for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The homemade salsa is fantastic, and I can eat an entire meal for less than $5. The employees are super friendly and the place is very clean. I can't recommend this place enough. Go. And get the pork tacos.

Clean, great quality Mexican fast food.  The meat tastes like real meat (can't say that about the other place nearby, (hint: rhymes with cAllende) and the ingredients are fresh. The staff is also attentive and gets to your order very promptly.   Definitely best Mexican in the area.

First of all, this has been my favorite chicken taco in the area for years. I saw a sign that said under new management recently. I am eating my beloved chicken taco right now and it is not the same. Shredded not chopped. I am sad. Good but not the same..bring it back!!

Best Fish Tacos in the city. Period.  I have been to all of the recommended fish taco purveyors and this one is the best.   Seriously though, the fish tacos are grilled on the flat top, not fried, which I prefer.  The fish is marinated, grilled, topped with pico, cabbage and radishes.  Top it with their delicious tangy verde sauce and watch your mouth explode.

How can you give a dive Mexican restaurant 5 stars, you ask?  First off,  I'm from Phoenix, Arizona and don't expect to find much for Mexican cuisine outside of there, this place could survive easily in phoenix.  Secondly, the workers are real Mexicans, from Michocan, Mexico and speak great English with a side of enthusiasm. Lastly, they are consistent and clean.  This place is more than just drunk food.      The palace is not a dinner date place, or somewhere to take out business partners, but it definitely can be eaten on a daily basis if you really enjoy Mexican food like I do. After eating here for my second time, I really loved how the food was exactly the same as the first time. I have never had pastor that I liked until I came here.  The marinade was tangy, not salty, and had dimension.  I usually find pastor boring, but this was far from it.  The asada was great as well, finely diced and generous helpings.  These tacos are actually quite big and extremely reasonable.  Since I am from phoenix, I do not welcome anything but cilantro  onions and salsa on my tacos.  The cook informed us that they normally put lettuce , tomatoes and cheese on the tacos Because the area likes it.  OK no, I'm white, American and lived everywhere, and even I find this gross. My new mission is to change the views of people in America to stop wanting Taco Bell fixings on Mexican food!  The workers were pleased to hear us want only natural toppings on our food.    Don't worry, you will enjoy it better this way. The cilantro and onions were very finely chopped and the salsas were both incredible.  I can't believe I also found some decent corn tortillas in this city! Astonishingly enough, nothing was greasy at all, and that's hard to find in phoenix even.  My friend ordered a chorizo and egg burrito.  This always worries me because he is used to some of the finest chorizo ever made, and even I wonder if it can be topped.  Bulls eye, this was an amazing burrito.  The chorizo was very different than any chorizo I have ever had, in a GREAT way.. I believe it was the use of oregano that gave it such flavor.  The cook knew what he was doing when he made this burrito.  He gave us the perfect balance of eggs to chorizo and the tortilla was nicely grilled to crisp it up (very Chicago thing to do, I learned).  Beans and rice were on target, guacamole was pleasantly seasoned and fresh.    You cannot go wrong here.  They also just give u a free cup if you want water instead of charging you $2 for a bottle of water without knowing it, I appreciate that.  Please just clean up your table, it's the rude people who leave the tables dirty, that can ruin there's experiences. They are cooks, not servers or busboys here. They get busy and you are paying inexpensive prices, don't get it twisted. Rule of thumb, if you have to get up to get your food from the counter, you also have to pick up after yourself.

Have been going here for at least 15 years. Maybe more. I always think my tastes will outgrow this place but I'm always surprised how good the food is. I work outside and eat out a lot. I have eaten at so many taco joints and none of them can compare. Never disappointed. I saw in some reviews that they rave about the fish tacos. I like everything except the fish tacos, they are average at best. Much better than any of the more expensive "high end" places too.

My friends here always deliver the goods! I'm here at least once a week. Aside from being the nicest guys on this side of Lincoln Park, they're tacos are on point and everything here is affordable. I've never had less than a great meal here. It's open late night, and there are usually soccer matches on every time I seem to come here. Minimalist decor, but it's a fantastic place to end the night or start the evening if you need a base before you go into the city with an agenda. A perfect example of what separates Chicago Mexican food from other major cities, and is what my friends demand when they're in town.
Had the enchiladas and had a less than great experience. Not what I was expecting considering all the good Mexican food in the area. Make your way north up Halstead for a better experience.
One of the most perfectly crafted burritos I've had. Rice and beans are delicious and fresh along with their amazing home made salsas. This place is a definite gem.

Best Mexican in Chicago. From burritos to tacos to quesadillas, everything they do is fantastic.  Service is relatively quick unless it's packed (as with any fast food place). The pork is the best tasting pork I've ever had from a Mexican place.

LOVE this place. Cheap with great food! Their pork tacos, chicken flautas, and steak burritos are pretty much all my boyfriend and I order. I really should try their other items, but whenever I think about getting food here I start craving their pork tacos, so it's really hard not to get them.
Best Ceviche Tostada in town!!!  They're open very late and this is a great place for an after bar/club stumble for food.  The staff is enthusiastic and friendly - makes me feel like I'm in Mexico!

$2 for an awesomely greasy and large quesadilla? What the heck?!?! I'm sold.  I wound up going here in between bars on a long run of Saturday night festivities. First and foremost, I must say I love Mexican food. And real Mexican food the way it was intended - wonderfully unhealthy. The food here, simple and cheap as it was, did not disappoint. I also enjoyed the fact that when I walked in and spoke my rudimentary Spanish, I was not scoffed at by the cooks and staff (presumably all Mexican?). They actually spoke back to me in Spanish and that made me feel like a champ. I was trying so they went with it. Funny how that made such an impression, but it did. It shows that they're genuine people.  I would like to make a visit again when I'm more on the side of sober, I enjoyed it that much. Greasy Mexican is wonderful while drinking, but I enjoy it anytime!
Best nachos ever. I've had them twice this week. The guys behind the counter are so nice and always make me smile. My favorite Mexican food in Chicago so far.
They've switched their chorizo from the spicy, red and jucy stuff to the mild and brown stuff everyone else uses. No bueno :-(

Lot of variety, including veggie options, which is unusual for a smaller place. Ate here plenty of times (sober ones too) and always tasty and not overly greasy. Love their fish tacos. Service is also great and respectable. Usually same 2 guys, they're a family...and unlike many other joints, they don't try to hit on you. Open til very late too!

These burritos are just different from the rest.  It isn't so much the quality of ingredients or the amount of food present, it is the way that they crisp the tortilla that makes it so much better than every other late night burrito place.  Simply the best of the best.

Veggie Burrito and Cherry Coke. When I was a kid, we used to stop here on our way back to the 'burbs from the city.  Always the same order, veggie burrito and cherry coke. To this day, I have not been able to find a better burrito/drink combination.  The local Mexican restaurant in my area I had to give a four star rating to because as far as burritos go they can't compare to Taco Burrito Palace. Having eaten at so many Mexican and faux-Mexican restaurants (Chipotle, Q'doba) I can honestly say Taco Burrito Palace is the only restaurant that has the best burritos I have ever eaten. Yum.

This could possibly be THE best taquería in Chicago.  Every time I go to another taco joint it never stacks up to what these guys have to offer.  The food is excellent, authentic and very affordable.  I usually have a fish taco and a quesadilla (make yourself a dang quesadilla Napolean!) with guacamole but their steak tacos (ask for tacos de asada for some street cred) and burritos are just as amazing. The tacos al pastor are kick ass as well as  their soup which is not on the menu but great also.  I have Mexican employees who ask to come here when I am paying for dinner, they like the tacos and the tortas.  I oblige without hesitation.  I found this place when they were at their other location down the block by the auto parts store when I first moved to Chicago 20 years ago (usually at 2am and buzzed) and have been a loyal customer ever since. The guys working the counter are the most polite and friendly vatos you could ask for.  You walk in and they say "Hi Amigo" all the time and when you leave they say thanks if they are up in the front.  The customer service is excellent. Chipolte is for chumps... why eat there when you can have authentic Mexican food on the cheap??  Thumbs all the way up.  Eat there once and I can almost guarantee that you will be hooked.

This place is great. I've become a regular. I mean it's what you expect with low prices... But it's easily way better to me than some pricey Mexican places in the area. Fast service, pretty fresh, good prices, and good menu. Plus the Horchata is awesome. I usually get the supreme steak quesadilla. YUM!
I stopped in last sunday, and it was very chill the service was great. and the Fish Tacos are the best in town you can't beat the price either $2. i will be back forsure

The staff is friendly and helpful. Prices are not bad. However, I would not recommend eating here unless you are a drunk / hungover college student, as that is what this food is made for. If you're drunk, you will love this stuff and they will be open late for you, so they totally deserve five stars.

I have searched the nation for fish tacos that are equal to those served by T&B Palace 2 and have come up with NOTHING. This place is legit. I drive to Chicago (from Nashville) for these fish tacos. And they're like TWO DOLLARS. TWO DOLLARS for the best fish tacos you've ever had. Why are you not eating here yet? Additionally, everything else is good. Just go already!
Best mexican food in the area. Great customer service. I come here all the time! I will always come here for great mexican food!
Great hangover food... I always left happy, and I've been here countless times.  I imagine being drunk would amplify the experience.  I just always wondered where Taco & Burrito Palace #1 is...

Drunk or not, "TB2" is the way to go.  It blows every other Mexican place within a few blocks out of the water, including Allende, La Bamba, and the dog food shack across the street (similarily named Taco Burrito EXPRESS #2).  If you feel like shaving a few minutes off your life, the steak Chimichanga is your best bet.  If you're light on cash, the quesadillas are simple yet filling.  All the meats are great for the price, and I haven't found a item on the menu I didn't like.  The Burrito suizo and enchiladas are two others that come to mind.  Oh yea...horchata. Don't let people tell you it's just drunk food.  They're either elitists or idiots.  Or, more likely, both.

Burrito was fresh and well-presented...but not particularly great. I like lettuce as much as the next person, but...lettuce does not a burrito make. Salsa was decent but very tame. Guys working there seemed nice, so. I didn't cry or anything.
This place is great for drunk food but nothing else. Get the steak burrito with hot sauce is good, but only after 2am.

Oh my goodness! I have been holding on to my receipt since March 10th just to make sure I Yelped this place! It was a late night out with my friends and I am famished *read tired NOT drunk* and I happen across this place because there is high traffic in and out the door. I figured.. I love Mexican, so I'll give it a try. I walked in and did not know what to expect since my surroundings were very drunk people looking to get a quick food fix.  I look on the menu and I say "Hmm, prices are reasonable. Cooks make to order and are efficient.." and then BAAM, I lose my train of thought because the cashier asks can he help me. This has to be the friendliest cashier I have encountered at a late night spot. I ordered the Burrito Pollo Small and was in heaven! The tortilla was crisped to perfection. They had a good amount of chicken and the perfect portion of toppings! This was delicious and a place I'd go back no matter the time of day! I get excited just typing this review. As the terminator would say, I'll be back... yea I know its cheesy but this place was good, quick, and reasonably priced!
Menu listed online is wrong, they don't have shredded beef :(
The cashier is one of the friendliest and hardest working guys i've met.  Whether its an early dinner or a late night snack after the bars, he's always welcoming and 4 stars for the food too!
Yay!  Great stuff here!  Fond memories of burritos!

Oh man do I love this place! I've been a patron of this place for over 10 years. When I first moved to Lincoln Park this was my go to spot for Mexican over any of the little joints over in that 6 corner intersection. I love the new location even more (albeit it's been there for a few years in the "new" location). They have a big menu for a quick taco joint. They have the best Steak Nachos and Chimichangas in that area. They also have some bomb fish tacos and chicken tortilla soup. What's even greater is that they have an endless supply of pickeled jalapenos and carrots....mmmmm

Stopped by for a quick bite, tried the beef empanadas they were very tasty and fresh and the horchata was ok. The prices are good and we would definitely come back and try some of the other menu items.

You don't have to be drunk or up late to enjoy Taco & Burrito Palace #2. This place has quality food to sooth your Mexican craving anytime of the day or night. I'd even go so far as to call this place the best Mexican joint on the North Side. If you know better I'd like to try it! This is actually the only place that I'll order a burrito. They wrap it up with delicious ingredients and then grill the outside. They... grill... the... outside... Soooo good.  Years ago they were located a few store fronts down in a much more run down space, but they've moved on up with a sleek look and flat screen tv always showing soccer matches. So now you can even take your friends here who cringe at dirty walls, but still want to enjoy delicious food at a great price.
By far, the BEST quick Mexican fare in all of Chicago...been here hundreds of times, and I will go hundreds more.  Their chorizo burrito especially....I'm out...gotta go get one...

I really wanted to like this place, and I did start out liking it. But then things took a turn for the worse--a stomach turn. I came here recently with friends prior to a show at Lincoln Hall. I ordered the veggie burrito dinner, which came with rice and beans. It was super cheap--a little over 6 bucks. I have to say that everything tasted fine in the moment, my only complaint being that some of the veggies in the burrito seemed a bit cold and raw. However, within about 10 minutes of finishing, my stomach felt like someone had poured a bucket of acid into it--and it continued feeling that way for about 12 hours. I can't really attribute this pain to anything other than the meal I had here. At certain points, I felt like I could barely stand up straight because my stomach hurt that much. I recovered the next day, but the dinner here really was not worth all the agony. I doubt I'll be returning.

When I was an early to mid 20's something bar hopper in this area I thought this place was the best... Then I grew up. This is nothing but a late night, drunk off your keyster, "I don't know anything about Mexican food so this is great" type taqueria.  It served its purpose when I was a young idiot, now...not so much.

As late night burrito haunts go, this one is somewhere in the middle of the pack.  The staff is outgoing and even enthusiastic, which is nice, but it's a pretty average burrito.  You could do a lot worse, though.

The best Mexican food in the city and the best service. They are all so friendly there, the food is always fresh and quick, and the location always clean. I work next door to this place and we all love it!

Awesome Mexican food! This is the place to go anytime, whether taking your family to lunch or late at night when you have the binge drinking munchies.They have great seafood tacos around lent time, highly recommend. The restaurant is pretty clean and the staff are really nice people.  How can you go wrong with a place that has photos of employee's throwing up gang signs on their yelp page? Orale Carnal!

Though the exterior leaves much to be desired this place isn't half bad! Their food is fast and good and will definitely fill you up.  They have 2 sizes of burritos and I like that because the smaller size is JUST enough for me!  The prices are good too!  The only thing I'm not a fan of is their high chairs and tables, I'm a shorty and that type of seating for ALL your tables is kind of annoying but hey, I can deal with it!

If your in the mood to have a foot race down Halsted at 4:30am outside Taco Burrito Palace #2 there's a good chance myself Tom Phelan, Brian Basic, and Adam Phillips we'll be there awaiting your challenge.  After the race it is likely that Tom or Adam will take a shot of #2's finest salsa... But enough about the fun activities that encompass a late night trip to #2... The food is very worth it. Plus it beats waiting in line for Allende though that establishment has a special place in my heart.  Moreover, TBP #2 is the cleanest late night Mexican place I have ever eaten at which is a huge bonus. The cooks there are also some of the best guys you'll meet.  Definitely check it out you won't be disappointed.

Thank you to the amazing staff at taco & burrito palace #2. I've come in drunk twice and you are still so kind even when I don't make sense or get your jokes. The nachos are amazing! i could eat two on my own. for real. chorizo or carne asada, with guac, onions, sour cream, cheese. They put everything on there! mmmmm so yummy. It was meant to be, you and I.  no hablo mucho espanol. muy delicioso!
Best cheap Mexican food in the area

Late night heaven!!! I was recently introduced to this place by friends who have been enjoying it for years.  I have been brought here twice now and both times have left extremely full, satisfied, and ready for bed!!! I have never tasted the food sober or earlier than 2 am, so this review is only from my drunken adventures here.  I have ordered some type of chicken burrito both times and both times the food has been good.  Each time, the food has not seemed greasy, but almost fresh tasting.  SOOO good after a long night of drinking. Also, the staff in here is awesome.  Super friendly, helpful, and EXTREMELY patient with the late night sort!!! The past time I was here I woke up with hellacious heartburn, but so worth it!!! I would definitely suggest Taco & Burrito Palace #2 to anyone looking for a late night bite.  I will most certainly be back!!!

OK, if you have lived anywhere north of Roosevelt Road and east of Western Ave and have never been here, move to Woodstock. This is a staple for anytime of the day tacos. The best time to come here is late afternoons. It's slow and relaxing. They guys working there are cool and respectful, so give them some love and fill that tip jar. Love the chicken tacos.

From the outside, this place doesn't look like much more than your typical late night burrito joint where you would never go during the day.  You walk in and are greeted by the super friendly staff.  The menu actually includes enchiladas, which is slightly more complicated than the standard late night Mexican dishes.  I know, Mexican food is all the same stuff presented differently, but the enchiladas take more care to construct, and TBP2 takes the time to make these very well.  The green sauce enchiladas are the best and come with beans, rice and avocado slices.   Two other unexpected surprises were free chips and salsa (just ask or wonder loudly about them within earshot of the staff) and really clean bathrooms!

Oh I love this place. My friends and I stumbled upon it by accident and I'm so happy we did. Portions are great, food is good, and they staff is really fun. I had a barcoca(I doubt I spelled that right) quesadilla Mmm so good. Horactia or rice water, delicious. And they great tamales not the ones with the donkey on the label, no real corn husk tamales with spicy chicken. I can't wait to go back to get tortilla soup. I left full and sleepy :)

I went to this place last night for a quick bite.  I purchased 3 tacos and one horchata.  The tacos are $1.80 each and the drink was $1.50.  I thought this was a great deal.  I got the steak and chorizo tacos.  They were both good but I liked the steak one better.  My one and only "complaint" is that they did not use cilantro on the tacos.  I love that flavor, so I'm curious if they can add it if you request it. All in all this was a good taco experience and I look forward to being back.

This place isn't going above and beyond, but it isn't disappointing either.  Right in the mediocrity sweet spot. This is another one of those places where you are getting no service buy still feel inclined to tip your cook.  All he did was carry a place five yards.  Does that mean 20%?

This place is my number 2 spot in Chicago... Service is always good, food is always good, open late, which is key.  Lotta young tough guidos in AE stripped shirt to navigate through, but normally worth it.  Safe for day time consumption even sober. Same owners as Mayan Palace down the block, which is worth a dinner trip!
Amazing! Great pork burrito with free chips! Delicious horchata

This was my first introduction to the burrito when I was 17 and a feshman in college.  We didn't have such places in my hometown.  So greasy but so good when you're wasted.  Here's a tip: Try a "Fajita Burrito" instead of your normal burrito and thank me later.  They use a better "stripish" steak than usual and it's about the same price. Tacos are actually really good too.

I used to eat here back in the day when cutting classes at good ol' LPHS (Lincoln Park High School). It was a bit of a hike so it was best saved when you were planning on taking an extended lunch period.   Either my tastebuds have matured since then or this place has gone down the shitter. Gary B. remarked that he's never been here under .08... and now I see why.   We stopped in tonight because after my husband said the word "burrito" in conversation, I NEEDED one.  The burrito wasn't impressive. The tortilla seemed a little stale. The hot sauce was WAY watery and not at all spicy... I used literally half a bottle over the course of dinner.  The saving grace: horchata. A very good horchata and I was wishing I had gone with a large instead of the small. Also, it appears they've had a renovation fairly recently so at least it's clean.  There's WAY better burritos closer to home so, Taco Burrito Palace, this is au revoir.  Err... adios.

Amazing!   Not really healthy, but this place has the best Tacos in town hands Down! Help me put the pressure on them to stop using Styrofoam for thier drinks!!   Every day they fill multiple, over-sized garbage cans with Styrofoam cups that are not recycled.  Recycling Styrofoam in downtown Chicago is not a possibility so I presume about 99% of take-out Styrofoam is also not recycled.  Help the planet and I'll keep coming.  To help the environment you could always show up with your own cup!   Please put the pressure on TB Palace #2 to stop using Styrofoam.

True story: A friend came to visit me in Chicago, and asked me in a bar, "where can you get the best Mexican in Chicago?" A perfect stranger and I said in union, "Taco and Burrito Palace #2!" and high-fived. It was an awesome moment. Anyway, Taco and Burrito Palace #2 is a very casual, but authentic and delicious Mexican joint. It's so good, you can eat it hungover and not feel sick. It's worth the walk past Taco and Burrito Palace #1!

I've been going to TBP #2 for sixteen years and have enjoyed every single meal.  Even if I can't stop by for a few months, they remember my regular order.  They may as well shout "Norm!" when I walk in.  Their friendly staff and tasty enchiladas will always keep me coming back.  Please note that this review is only valid for daytime patrons.  All meals were served before the bars closed & the  reviewer was sober.
Yummy at all hours, actually. Free pickled veggies to munch on while you wait or to bulk up your tacos are a plus.

Late night mexican food. Yes, at 3am and stuff. Oh, and its really good too. If you like horchata this is the place to go. For those who have never had it before if you have had cinnamon toast crunch and let it soak in milk, the resulting milk tastes like horchata.  Awesome overall.

My coworkers and I sometimes get lunch here.  It's greasy but it's cheap and it tastes good enough.  I'm mostly giving it four stars because they have free refills on horchata, which is pretty amazing.  They're also pretty nice there and you always want to see nice people do well at what they're doing...

Could be the best taqueria in the DePaul area.  That's not saying much, as Lincoln Park taquerias are low-hanging fruit (perfect for students with alcohol-numbed taste buds).  The exterior makes this spot look questionable but it's clean inside.

Has it really been a decade since i've been going here? Are the SAME cooks still in there? YUP. TBP used to be located about half a block down the street, and the atmosphere felt much better there, but the food is still the same and really that is all that matters.  The food is on point. I've never had anything bad, and it's as close to traditional mexican food as you can in the area. Tacos are always good, even better mexican style (onions and cilantro only). Tortas are my second favorite.  Can get kind of annoying on a saturday night when it's full of obnoxiously drunk college students, but still worth it for the cool headed.  Parking sucks... The old spot was right next to a autoshop which was obviously closed at night. Don't be confused by all the Taco Burrito Kings around, cause its a close second place, but DEFINITELY NOT the same. I know this is taco burrito palace number #2, and i've never been to or seen #1, so in my eyes this is the number one. These guys feel like distant cousins and they always remember me, even if I haven't stopped in for a year or so.

This place is the best.  i have been going here for almost 20 years.  It never disappoints.  Junior Steak burrito is big enough for me but the regular burritos are awesome too.  They don't have to rely on gimmicks like making the burrito so big that you don't notice any lack of flavor. A definite spot after a night on the town or even before going out.  Highly recommended.

Let's take a look at an interesting naming convention amongst cheap Mexican restaurants in Chicago: Taco & Burrito Palace Taco & Burrito Palace #2 Taco & Burrito Place Taco Burrito Express Taco & Burrito Express Taco Burrito King Taco & Burrito House Taco and Burrito House The Famous Taco Burrito Famous Taco & Burrito Kings El Rey del Taco Y el Burrito Best Taco Burrito It doesn't take a scientist to detect a pattern here.  Either there's a mastermind Mexican food mogul opening up low-margin late night places, or there's something about Mexican food enterprises in general that lends itself to lack of creativity in naming and/or the need to let your potential patrons know exactly what they'll be getting should they choose to walk in your front door. Nevertheless, I've found myself at the entrance to my affectionately nicknamed "TBP 2" numerous times throughout the years.  It's usually pretty late, and I'm usually not in a position to judge their food critically, but god damn if it doesn't get the job done.  There may be a million Taco (&) Burrito (king or building in which a king lives) (express) establishments in this town, but this is MY Taco (&) Burrito (king or building in which a king lives) (express) establishment in this town.  And I'll defend it to the death as long as I've got a few beers in me.   Salud!

A solid 4 stars.  Taco and Burrito Palace looks like it will be a dump on the outside, but it's large and clean inside.  The food is consistently excellent, from top to bottom.  The salsa is excellent too.  And it's very affordable.  I'd generally get a steak burrito or a chicken taco and steak tostada, and I never left disappointed.  The gentlemen working are efficient and friendly.  When I'm back in Chicago, I'll be back.

I think I first visited TBP#2 some 20 years ago when I got my first real job & apartment in the city. I still wonder to this day...was there actually a TBP#1? At any rate, even after all these years, this is still my first choice for a burrito.  Like many others, most of my visits have taken place in the wee hours which can slant one's view. But I have actually graduated to sober visits now when in the neighborhood at lunch, so hopefully my reviews are not too tainted.  Their burritos have so much more flavor than the doughy, overstuffed behemoths you find at the chain places. All of their menu selections have authentic style and flavor, you get plenty of food and it will cost you relatively nothing.  I get a chuckle out of the previous decor comments. Hard to hold high expectations out of a late night Mexican joint in that category. But believe me...this location is a huge upgrade from the original place they had further down Halsted near Fullerton.

Oh dear God, there is nothing like stuffing your face with good cheap Mexican food after a night of liver punching!  Small admission: I have never been here when I was completely sober but for drunk food this is it.  They know what they do well and they stick to it.  Burritos, cheap tacos, guys ordering "dyou knoooowww tacos are goodzzzz",little cinnamon gum on your way out, $5-$7; not feeling like you're going feel this one tomorrow... priceless

I wasn't expecting much from this place just looking at the sign. I had a taco, chips and salsa and my boyfriend had a burrito. It was solidly good, but not necessarily very flavorful on its own. The dining room and bathrooms were very clean. It was a good place to stop in if you are in the neighborhood and want quick mexican.

Not much for decor...but don't let this place fool ya... I personally think they have one of the best carne asada tacos in town.  And for $5, you can also get a ginormous burrito... I also do love their horchata!   Best place to stop by for munchies after a night of drinking... :)

been giong there since i was just a wee-depaul-ite. at 2 am, i will not stand in line and cant wait to shoot the shit with my fav group of mexicans. i like that they know me by name and am sad that their main guy is consistantly on vacay. their steak burrito is great.. but i challenge you, get the olympico. its 2 tortillas interlocked like olympic rings and stuffed with..  well you get the idea. all i can remember is I woke up at 5 am with a 1/3 eaten of this monster laying on my chest and salsa on my hair.. yeah buddy.

Pros: Cheap, tasty, dive atmosphere, friendly service, really good Mexican food.   Cons: It's unhealthy... but hey... it's Mexican food what do you expect, they need a picture menu. Had the burritos and the quesadillas. the burritos are great, full of flavor, and they fry the outside of the burrito so it has a little bit of a crunch.  This place is heaven when it comes to Divey Mexican Food. I don't like giving out 5 stars but this place deserves one.

Great food, but not quite on the same level as places like La Pasadita or Traspasada in terms of quality cheap Mexican grub.  Their burrito is a little heavy on the lettuce and lighter on the meat, but the lengua was delicious.  A little smaller than I expected.  I wasn't too impressed by the salsa.  But if it's getting late and I'm in the area, I'd definitely come back.

I totally agree with Craig C. Nobody should bother writing a review about your stomach ache the day after a night of drinking.... Because I'd venture to guess that the 5 jager bombs and 10 beers you had last night are probably more culpable for the stomach ache than the gigantic burrito you thought you needed at 4am when the bars all closed. Ahhh but I digress! This place is amazing. The guac is fresh, the burritos are huge, the orchata is spiced right and the guys behind the counter are hilarious. They have a great sense of humor and a huge amount of patience to deal with the late night customers! I respect that!  Also, my sister and her husband met here about 17 years ago and it's also where he proposed to her a few years after that, so the place holds a little sliver of romance in my heart. What can I say? Burritos bring people together :)

I had a suzio (sp?) burrito (~$6-7). This is one of those order, pay, wait, and eat restaurants and overall I had a good experience here. The burrito had a great taste and it was plentiful as well. It was a real burrito meaning that it had more than just meat and beans wrapped in a tortilla and it wasn't that disgusting shredded-what-part-of-the-chicken-am-eating style of meat. They grill it right in front of you and chop it up. Chew carefully though because you occasionally find chicken bone pieces. I would eat here again. Food Quality/Taste = 4 Stars Portion Size Given Price = 4 Stars Price = 4 Stars Service = n/a Experience with Staff = 3 Stars Decor = 2 Stars

I come here many times at night, and during the day.  It's quality inexpensive mexican food.  To be honest I've only tried to steak tacos, but they are delicious.  Both the red and green salsas are a must.  The guys who work there are really friendly as well.  Also the fries are normally made to order and really good.

How anyone can give a late night taco joint a bad review is beyond me...it's a LATE NIGHT TACO STAND for crying out loud.  Your stomach hurt in the morning after drinking all night and then eating a burrito?  What did you expect?  Some of you people are just absurd, and need to stop with the ridiculous reviews.

This is one of my favorite late night spots to hit up after a night of drinking! I have to give big kudos to anyone who works there who is always so nice about me being drunkenly loud, and they almost always remember what I want!  Their chorizo and egg burrito is great, and is even better in the morning! I also frequent the onion rings and steak tacos: muy bueno!  They're not too pricey which is nice. They have a few tables there, but by the time I get there- I'm ready just to walk home!

Like most people we ventured to Taco Burrito Palace after a long night of music and beer. The (vegan) vegetarian burrito I had was quite satisfying at the time. When I woke up in the morning, my stomach was still poking at the burrito, trying to decide what it was. There are a couple other late-night burrito places that have larger, better burritos. I might be back if I'm in this neighbourhood though.

The chimichanga was pretty awesome.  Rice and beans were great.  Horchata was alright.  The cooks were very nice and attentive.   Hope you don't mind watching people carry their friends to the bathroom so they can barf after a night of hilarious youthful drinking.  Or watching the local douche bags dry hump eachother whilst they wait for their food.

Mediocre at best, this place gets the third star simply for a cheap deal: 2 chicken tacos, rice, beans and a large soda for $4.95. Otherwise, nothing special to comment. It's not bad food. This place is not a bad choice in this horrendous economy.

Taco and Burrito Palace 2 provides the best value for Mexican food in the area.  Their food is a couple bucks more than the cheap take-out places in the area, however, I think it's usually worth the extra buck! I would highly recommend the enchiladas...I think that's the best thing they serve.  Great flavor and not scary meat!   They just redid the interior and the service is always great.  I would highly recommend T&BP2 for a quick lunch or dinner whenever you have a hankerin' for Mexican.

I know this isn't the craziest most awesome mex food in the city, but there are some things about this place that get me every time.   1. the guy that takes the order is really nice 2. apple soda in a bottle 3. the steak burrito with extra cheese 4. cheese fries. Everything here is solid, in fact yday it was darn right great. It's fast, cheap, easy to get to and it's good.
What the hell? This place wasn't made out of Mexcan food at all. I had the Grande Burrito, which was medium tasty and very cheap.

I give this little restaurant five stars because I think it is "best in class" for a takeout Mexican place, although it also offers inside dining.  Living several blocks away, this has become my "go to" place for Mexican and I have not had a bad meal there yet.  The staff is very friendly and helpful, the food freshly made, and the price is very right!  I always do takeout and the hot food is still hot when I get home.  Plus, I really enjoy patronizing a local small business and not a multinational chain with higher prices and less tasty food.  I now call ahead and pick up almost as soon as I get there.
Chorizo. Thats all you need to know.  And Jalapenos in the jar at the end of the counter. That too. This place rocks - fast service, good food, great prices. Just try it.

Not a better burrito in the world. Trust me, I've tried one everywhere. Nothing beats a trip to the Pa-leece after a long night of drinking. And, I am also guilty of a sober trip here once in a while as well. The quesadillas are the best, the tacos ain't too bad and the salsa is better than any other.

This place may be T&B Palace #2 in name, but it is #1 in my heart. The eats aren't gourmet, but they are flavorful, freshly made and will fill you up. I especially like the quesadillas, which combine the right amount of meat without drowning you in cheese. The tacos and burritos are also winners - palace-worthy, even? They also offer fish tacos, but I only had them once and was not overly impressed. That was also the only fish taco I have ever had, so I have nothing to compare it to.  The dining area is smallish without being cramped, and everything seems to be exceptionally clean. If I had one quibble, it would be that there is not, and never has been, a garbage can. I can only assume that this is so drunken people don't pitch the plates and utensils, but it is nonetheless odd. T&BP #2 also scores favorably because they have great staff. I've been coming to this place for about five years, and just about everyone who works there now worked there then. They're friendly, attentive, and obviously know how to fire up a great burrito.  I imagine a lot of people come here for a booze-induced post-closing time snack, but it does wonders for a sober diner like myself. I most definitely recommend this as one of the better establishments in the area.

I have been eating here for at least 15 years (including the predecesor place a few doors south). This is better than at least 80% of typical sit down mexican restaurants in town.  It is cleary, one of the top tacquerrias in Chicago. All the food is excellent and seems to be quite hand made.  KILLER FRENCH FRIES on top of everything else. Portions are just huge, so downsize your orders accordingly.  Excellent food--always open--very nice guys.

TBP #2.  Where to begin?  Well, we've known eachother for a long time now TBP #2.  Sometimes I have been grossly overserved before we met up and other times I have just been in need of a quick fix of your particular brand of Mexican deliciousness.  Regardless, you always accept me.  Your Cherry Coke is the perfect compliment to the tacos that I inhale with nary a consideration for my health.  It truly has been a great relationship. Despite the multiple rodent sightings inside and outside of your doors, I have continued and will continue to enjoy your spicy delights.  Somehow, your tasty foodstuffs have transcended logic and good judgement and I continue to patronize your restaurant.  I love you TBP#2.  Always have.  Always will.

The Palace is one of the crown jewels of late night Lincoln Park eating.  While they moved away from their tiled wall location a half block away a few years ago, the new place is fancy smancy to keep up and look like Chipotle.   In my view, Taco Burrito Place wipes the floor with Chipotle every day of the week and into next year.  If you are ever fiending for a quesadilla, drop on in and you'll be satisfied to get a giant quesadilla that's as big as an omelette.   Taco Burrito is super fast and offers a variety of meat and guacamole for your food.  Their new menu includes soups and fish tacos (watch out they are spicy!).  The people who work there are friendly and keep the place clean despite all of the trash that rolls out from all of the bar and eats there.

I've lived in California for 10 years, and you'd think I would have found a place to buy Mexican food which could equal or better TBP.  Not so. When I lived in the city, I lived within a reasonable distance of both TBP #1 and #2. I didn't realize how lucky I was.  Can I convince you guys to open TBP down the street from me?

Not at all close to my house.  If I'm anywhere near this place I have to stop in for the fajita burrito, so delicious!  The nachos are great too.  The service is great and everyone has always been super friendly, even with all of our special requests.  Good salsa, great hot sauce.  This is great cheap eats, one of my favorite chicago dives.

Ah, The Taco N' Burrito palace! What better place to gorge on extremely large fatty food after a hard night's dancing to blues bands? I must confess, this was actually the first burrito I'd ever eaten in my life! I am however, now really into them, and have found similarly good places in Hamburg (Kombuse). I couldn't finish mine - so bonus points if you can
TBP gets the Burrito Baby treatment.  4/5 burritos.  See the pork, see the steak.  See the Baby, singularly unimpressed. youtube.com/v/166Sd-j2fw…

I recently visited this place on my crawl to get something to eat. And what did find... none other then good old taco/taqueria. The prices were good especially when comparing them to other taquerias west of the area. I enjoyed the Carne asada and there Chorizo. The horchata was a bit sweet for my tastes but that definitely didn't keep me from drinking it. Also the hot sauces was pretty good and compliments the tacos very well.   Finally the guys were the kitchen were great, attitude service and friendliness are all qualities they possess.

I did not have a good burrito from Taco & Burrito Palace #2. My carne asada burrito was made of ground beef that tasted like grocery store Ortiz packet taco meat. It had sogged through the tortilla by the time I got home. The staff was friendly, service was quick and the eats were cheap. Plus they are open late night, if you need a beer-soaker-upper. But if you are looking for a real burrito, head elsewhere. That said, my cherry coke was delicious!

This place is fantastic. It's my favorite cheap Mexican spot. The ingredients are fresh and the food is not greasy. The only problem is if you go late-ish on a weekend it will be packed with drunk fools.

This is a good late night spot. They have a poker machine. The veggie burrito is good. Its more grilled than most and they put bell pepper in it, which can be nice. Many drunks there, I once accidentaly got into an altercation there involving a guy calling my friends dykes and the guy at the poker machine interviened but not before we got a napkin thrown at us. But i keep coming back there, so it has its apeal.
I've eaten here drunk AND completely sober. It's great. As a vegetarian, it's sometimes hard to find good, cheap mexican food. Their veggie tacos are amazing. I'm so glad I live close!
This is the best "quick" mexican restaurant in the city. The food here is always fresh, and you don't get any fat & grizzle with your steak. ORDER THE BARBACOA!!!
veggie tacos kinda suck. chile rello was horrible.

Hands down, this place has the deliciousist veggie burrito IN THE WORLD!!! It's so good that I can't imagine even attempting to eat anything else on their menu, and I'm normally quite an adventurous eater outer.*  Consider these things: I am not a vegetarian.  It is inconvenient for me to get to this place as I live nowhere near it. I don't care for the neighborhood.  Yet, despite these things, I still manage to come here on a fairly regular basis, and purposely do so when I am sober, so as to heighten the senses in my tongue.  I have to go now. I have to eat me a bigass veggie burrito from Taco & Burrito Palace #2! *Please note this review is based solely on the quality of the veggie burrito.

I can honestly say that I have never dined here un-inebriated, but I gobble it down every time, despite the acrid stench of chopped onions and cilantro (it's the cebolla I take offense to, not the cilantro) piled high on MOL's steak tacos, just how she likes them. I just put my head down and eat. Mow.

Everyone in Chicago has been here at least once, usually after a long night of partying.  And yes, in that state, this is undeniably a terrific burrito joint.  What's really remarkable about this place, however, is that the food here actually tastes great outside the hours of 1 and 5 AM.  In fact, the food here is great all the time! Recently, they started serving barbacoa burritos.  If you haven't had one, try it.  It's really delicious.  Even during the day.  Even when NOT wasted.

hands down my favorite burrito place in chicago.  so much so that i come here even when NOT drunk.  The new location (a few doors down from the old) is all shiny and new and has a bathroom that won't scare you sober.  as always, the burritos are HUGE and i think the menu has expanded (they have fish tacos now!  i LOVE me some fish tacos) and the horchata is definitely improved, less gritty and more cinnamon-y.  can't go wrong with a breakfast burrito.  one negative, the chairs are dangerously high up and i'm rather short...

TBP moved to a nicer, newer location just a few buildings away. This place is very clean, and the food is pretty good. My husband thinks the food is heaven and comes here at lesat once a week. I have had the guacamole, chicken tacos, vegetarian tacos, and the vegetarian taco salad. They are very accommodating to special requests, especially vegetarian entrees. My husband loves their steak tacos.  Parking is difficult in this area but there is a 15 minute waiting spot for takeout.
Dirty, greasy, will kill you.  Yet super tasty especially when you're drunk.  It is one of the best grimy taquerias in the area.

Known simply as "the Palace" in my circles.  And you know, it's finger-licking good when you're sober too.  There have been days when I've done a double and had it for lunch and then late-night- because it's just that damn good. I am a vegetarian- kind of.  Eat fish too.  Anyway,  the veggie burrito at the Palace earns its place as a desert island food.  Alongside the egg McMuffin-no-meat.. For their veggie burritos, they sautee a green pepper onion mix in a special crack-heroin-nicotine sauce and voila!  The best veggie burrito I've ever had.   You have not lived unless you have been to the Palace.

New, fancy schmancy location.  I went last night and oh man, was that burrito ENORMOUS!  Enormous and delicious.  I don't know if these monster burritos are a byproduct of their new digs or if I was just too drunk the last time I was there to remember how much burrito was consumed.  Either way, thank you Taco and Burrito palace 2 for filling my tummy with foot long burrito goodness.
Hits the spot after a long night of drinking. Have not been sober.

Although I first started going to TBP2 after a long night drinking, I was coerced into going sober.   I was so embarrassed to be walking into TBP2 during daylight.  It made it worse that there is always a back up of traffic to Fullerton and I felt everyone was judging me (they probably were). However, I realized that I love their chips and salsa (the mixture is a little different at the new location) and I love the fact that I can see what they are cooking!   The guys behind the counter are really nice although my boyfriend says it is only because I am a girl but whatever!  It is kinda funny to see they also bought a flat screen TV in the new place.  And I haven't seen the new location at it's full potential yet (lines out the door at 3am) but I am looking forward to it!

Sixteen reviews and not one mention of the chimichanga?!!!  If you are looking for a deep fried log stuffed with carne asada and then drenched in guacamole and sour cream, you've just hit the jackpot.  Always get the carne asada, the other meats don't really cut it.

aka TB2 (or TBP2) One of the best burrito places in the city.  I was introduced to it while drunk, but now regularly go there for dinner and it never disappoints.  I get either the steak burrito or the steak quesadilla. They let the burrito get toasty on the grill, which I really like, however the way they fold it allows for drippage if you like to pick up your burrito, so be careful.
This is one of the two drunk food places that I go to after drinking ALL night.  I always get a cheese quesadilla and a large coke! YUM!

Is this place as good as I'm about to make it out to be?  I have no idea.  I've never been there sober.  But there has been many a night when, as my compassionate friends try to drive me home, I am yelling out the window, "Stop!  STOP!  TBP!  Please!"  There is nothing like a greasy quesadilla or big burrito at 4AM.  Don't be surprised if you decide to visit and see me behind the counter at the grill!
The best Mexican fare on a strip that offer four Mexican restaurants.  Gotta love the dude with the pot leaf on his hat serving up your burrito or quesadilla!
Greasy and fatty burrito joint.  Not the greatest food.  Usually filled with obnoxious yuppies and kids (drunk) from the LP area.

This was my college burrito place- waaay back when (I remember being upset when they remodeled and replaced the hand written menu on the wall and tiled everything).  After a night of drinking, more than a few times I woke up the next morning with one of their burritos laying half eaten and half dressed in it's aluminum foil next to me in bed.  Even more often I've thrown TPB2 burritos up- Mmmm.   So I guess I can recommend this place if you want to pass out next to, or throw up, a burrito.  As far as eatin' goes, they're really just OK- but for many, this place makes a lot of late night memories.
this place kept me fed for at least a year.  I remember stumbling home after a 4:30am trip th the TBPII.....it was always glorious and always worth the walk...no matter how tired and stumbling I was.
mmm...yummy for when you are drunk. The service is fast and friendly, and the food can't be any better for the price.

I'm giving The Palace (aka The Deuce) a conditional four stars.  When they're on, this is the best burrito joint on the planet(yeah, I've been to Rick's in Pasadena).  Killer griddled burritos, solid guacamole, great chicken enchiladas, awesome chorizo quesadillas(watch the dripping grease if you're eating in the car) and the best Horchata I've ever had.   You have to watch it, though. Once in awhile they screw with the quality of meat.  For years I bragged to friends that I never had one bite of gristle in a Palace burrito, but sadly, the last two years, they've disappointed a few times.  Great late night scene. Go to the john before you leave the bar, though...not the best bathroom.   The staff is great.  Be sure to use the tip jar. They DO appreciate it.
TBP #2!  You must go here; drunk or sober, the burritos are great!  I also like the guacamole (not the best, but good).  Like most taco stands, sanitariness is questionable.

This place has great burritos, as well as good quesidillas and guacamole. Order the smaller burrito, the regular ones are huge. This place can get kind of crazy late at night as the bars empty out and drunken revelers look for food to shovel.

If you're new to the city and don't know it that well, this is THE spot. You're not going to find anything to satisfy your beer-fueled hunger any better at 2 am than TBP. While the joint can get a little packed as the bars empty out, the food is definatley worth it. Some personal advice: get a "junior" burrito and not a regular. The junior is plenty big and your digestive system will thank you in the morning for it. Also, if you feel like being adventurous try the "horchata." It's cinnamon rice water and very delicious. Oh, and one last thing when the guy bangs the tip jar against the counter, that means it's your turn to order.
